page.title: 04TANGLES
page.content: One of the many pastimes people do for profit is to gather "Tangles". "Tangles" is the name that Orcadians use for the kind of seaweed otherwise called kelp or oarweed. The tangle gatherer collects the tangles which have been thrown up on the beach by the sea.The gatherer then puts a steel rope around a bunch and it is pulled up over the beach by a tractor.It is then put together into bigger piles and left to dry.When it has finished drying the weight will have decreased to about half the original, and will have shrunk to half the size of before drying. The tangles are then transported to the south of Scotland or England. The tangles sell for approximately Â£100 per ton.
